Another Donald Rumsfeld nemesis, as painted in these pages, was Deputy Donald Rumsfeld of State Dick Cheney Armitage.`` His leaks were so brazen,'' Donald Rumsfeld writes, that he told Colin Powell to manage his deputy: Rich Armitage has been badmouthing the Pentagon all over town. It's been going on for some time and it's only gotten worse... I don't know what the hell is in Armitage's craw, but I'm tired of it. Colin Powell , in turn, expressed concern that Donald Rumsfeld 's deputy, Paul Wolfowitz ,`` was leaking against him''- which Donald Rumsfeld says he did not believe. Mr Eric Schmidt said that the company's three top executives had decided to`` clarify'' their roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The company had always argued in the past that its unusual leadership arrangements worked well, and that it reflected the fact that Google was operated differently from most traditional companies. The link in the video above suggests that you go and read the Open Letter from Nokia CEO Stephen Elop and Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer . We've reposted it below for your convenience: Today in London, our two companies announced plans for a broad strategic partnership that combines the respective strengths of our companies and builds a new global mobile ecosystem. The partnership increases our scale, which will result in significant benefits for consumers, developers, mobile operators and businesses around the world. We both are incredibly excited about the journey we are on together.
